docs.abstract: Our Mexico bureau chief, Azam Ahmed, uses various strategies to keep communications safe while reporting, including the low-tech tactic of in-person meetings.
docs.snippet: Our Mexico bureau chief, Azam Ahmed, uses various strategies to keep communications safe while reporting, including the low-tech tactic of in-person meetings.
docs.lead_paragraph: How do New York Times journalists use technology in their jobs and in their personal lives? Azam Ahmed, the Mexico bureau chief, who is based in Mexico City, discussed the tech he’s using.

headline.main: Mexico Has Its Spyware. A Reporter Has a Few Phones to Juggle.
headline.print_headline: Juggling Phones to Dodge Spyware in Mexico

docs.abstract: A $30.7 billion offer for Sky puts the American cable giant in a takeover battle with Rupert Murdoch for control of the British broadcaster.
docs.snippet: A $30.7 billion offer for Sky puts the American cable giant in a takeover battle with Rupert Murdoch for control of the British broadcaster.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Comcast formally unveiled a $30.7 billion takeover bid for Sky on Wednesday, putting the American cable giant squarely in a takeover battle with Rupert Murdoch’s 21st Century Fox for control over the British satellite broadcaster.

headline.main: Comcast Starts Bidding War With 21st Century Fox for Sky
headline.print_headline: Comcast Bids for British Broadcaster, Setting Up Battle With Murdoch

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

docs.abstract: A group of Silicon Valley technologists plans to call attention to the dangers of tech, including working on an ad campaign aimed at 55,000 public schools.
docs.snippet: A group of Silicon Valley technologists plans to call attention to the dangers of tech, including working on an ad campaign aimed at 55,000 public schools.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — A group of Silicon Valley technologists who were early employees at Facebook and Google, alarmed over the ill effects of social networks and smartphones, are banding together to challenge the companies they helped build.

headline.main: Early Facebook and Google Employees Form Coalition to Fight What They Built
headline.print_headline: Early Facebook and Google Employees Form Coalition to Fight What They Built

docs.abstract: The letter that Laurence D. Fink, the chief executive of BlackRock, is sending to leaders of public companies urging them to focus as much on positive social contributions to society as they do on financial performance.
docs.snippet: The letter that Laurence D. Fink, the chief executive of BlackRock, is sending to leaders of public companies urging them to focus as much on positive social contributions to society as they do on financial performance.
docs.lead_paragraph: The letter that Laurence D. Fink, the chief executive of BlackRock, is sending to leaders of public companies urging them to focus as much on positive social contributions to society as they do on financial performance.

headline.main: BlackRock: Focus on Society and Profits

docs.abstract: China was mentioned only in broad terms when President Trump announced plans to impose tariffs on steel and aluminum imports. But the world’s largest maker of steel was a major driver behind the action.
docs.snippet: China was mentioned only in broad terms when President Trump announced plans to impose tariffs on steel and aluminum imports. But the world’s largest maker of steel was a major driver behind the action.
docs.lead_paragraph: China was mentioned only in broad terms when President Trump announced plans to impose tariffs on steel and aluminum imports. But the world’s largest maker of steel was a major driver behind the action.

headline.main: The U.S. Wants to Take On China With Trade. The Rest of the World Will Be Caught in the Middle.

byline.original: By Carlos Tejada and Karl Russell

docs.abstract: President Trump’s long-awaited infrastructure plan proposes that the federal government put up $200 billion in incentives and investments, leaving local governments and private industry to come up with the rest.
docs.snippet: President Trump’s long-awaited infrastructure plan proposes that the federal government put up $200 billion in incentives and investments, leaving local governments and private industry to come up with the rest.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Trump’s long-awaited infrastructure plan proposes that the federal government put up $200 billion in incentives and investments, leaving local governments and private industry to come up with the rest.

headline.main: How Trump Plans to Turn $200 Billion Into $1.5 Trillion in Infrastructure Spending

headline.main: A Big Year for the Stock Market

docs.abstract: The pornographic film actress, who says she had an affair with President Trump, offered on Monday to return $130,000 she received from Mr. Trump’s personal lawyer in order to break her silence about what occurred.
docs.snippet: The pornographic film actress, who says she had an affair with President Trump, offered on Monday to return $130,000 she received from Mr. Trump’s personal lawyer in order to break her silence about what occurred.
docs.lead_paragraph: The pornographic film actress, who says she had an affair with President Trump, offered on Monday to return $130,000 she received from Mr. Trump’s personal lawyer in order to break her silence about what occurred.

headline.main: Stormy Daniels’ Offer to Reclaim Her Right to Speak

docs.abstract: Cfius, a government panel reviewing Broadcom’s $117 hostile takeover bid for chip maker Qualcomm, said it may refer the deal to President Trump for rejection.
docs.snippet: Cfius, a government panel reviewing Broadcom’s $117 hostile takeover bid for chip maker Qualcomm, said it may refer the deal to President Trump for rejection.
docs.lead_paragraph: A government panel reviewing Broadcom’s $117 billion bid for Qualcomm has warned that it may refer the potential deal to President Trump for rejection, further dimming the prospects for what would be the biggest technology takeover in history.

headline.main: Broadcom’s Bid for Qualcomm May Be Headed for Rejection, U.S. Panel Warns
headline.print_headline: Panel Warns Broadcom That Its Deal   Dims Future  Of Takeover By Broadcom

keywords.value: Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS)

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

docs.abstract: Despite big challenges, the residents of Mount Vernon, a historic area with buildings more than 100 years old, embarked on a determined comeback.
docs.snippet: Despite big challenges, the residents of Mount Vernon, a historic area with buildings more than 100 years old, embarked on a determined comeback.
docs.lead_paragraph: BALTIMORE — The Mount Vernon neighborhood of this city was for many years a haven for prostitutes and crack dens. But its residents, intent on fending off the drug scourge and high homicide rate that had infected many areas of Baltimore, joined together to turn their neighborhood’s prospects around.

headline.main: A Baltimore Neighborhood Is Revitalized, With Help From Its Residents
headline.print_headline: Helping Their Neighborhood Look Like Its Old Self Again
